hints.content:
To compare fractions, both wholes must be the same size.

Which image shows $\dfrac{2}{4}$ and $\dfrac{1}{4}$ represented on the same size whole?

This image shows $\dfrac{2}{4}$ and $\dfrac{1}{4}$ on the same size wholes. Now it is fair to compare them!

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two circles of the same size. There is a greater than sign between the circles. The first circle is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The second circle is divided into four equal parts. One part is shaded. The total shaded area of the first circle covers more space than the shaded area of the second circle. !

hints.content:
This image best allows us to compare the fractions.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two circles of the same size. There is a greater than sign between the circles. The first circle is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The second circle is divided into four equal parts. One part is shaded. The total shaded area of the first circle covers more space than the shaded area of the second circle. !

question.content:
**Which picture best helps us compare $\dfrac{2}{4}$ and $\dfrac{1}{4}$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: The first triangle is smaller than the second triangle, so it is not fair to compare the fractions.
choices.content: ![Two triangles of different sizes. There is a less than sign between the triangles. The first triangle is small. It is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The second triangle is big. It is divided into four equal parts. One part is shaded. The total shaded area of first triangle covers less space than the shaded area of the second triangle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f829331dde672c45e2017c27dd8c1b3af41b5057)

choices.clue: The first rectangle is smaller than the second rectangle, so it is not fair to compare the fractions.
choices.content: ![Two rectangles of different sizes. There is an equal sign between the rectangles. The first rectangle is divided into 4 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The second rectangle is bigger than the first rectangle. It is divided into 4 equal parts. 1 part is shaded. The total shaded area of the first rectangle covers the same amount of space as the shaded area of the second rectangle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2aa130ecc427fd264b06df4da82ca1c5fccd7248)

choices.clue: The circles are the same size, so it is fair to compare the area of the fractions.
choices.content: ![Two circles of the same size. There is a greater than sign between the circles. The first circle is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The second circle is divided into four equal parts. One part is shaded. The total shaded area of the first circle covers more space than the shaded area of the second circle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/95400a65b1e4a217a0fc1915c664212e676d06a0)
